Kawrea expedition stops appearing?
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Expeditions: Kawrea: Kawrea expedition stops appearing?
By have clue -- will travel on Wednesday, June 21, 2000 - 07:03 am:

I finally got a Phoenix (which cleared the Big 4 without any special raising methods, though he'd need to bring a bazooka under one wing to dent Most), and figured I'd go back with him and do
one more pass on the Kawrea expedition to look for the Joker mask.

One problem -- Dr. Talico has STOPPED COMING. Rovest shows up like clockwork, Kavaro is always there, Talico is AWOL.

Could this be because I still have the Gods' Slate in my inventory? (And should I?) Kavaro seemed to have no hesitation towards going back to his expedition after he'd found all the goodies...

By torey_luvullo on Wednesday, June 21, 2000 - 09:24 am:

talico is the hardest expeditioner to get to come. your monster needs a higher life and fame requirement for talico than you do for the others.

By have clue -- will travel on Wednesday, June 21, 2000 - 11:18 am:

Ah, a life requirement! That's probably what I'm missing. The Phoenix I had in waiting has INT 950+, Fame 100, but only LIF ~250 or so. The monster that found the Feather that led to this Phoenix had a LIF a bit over 280.

If the Phoenix has any juice left in him (which is iffy -- he's in the aging stage, and giving him a Silver Peach now may be wasting it), I'll try and build that up to 280 and see if he comes back.

Unfortunately, I have a suspicion that final-stage monsters are handicapped in what they can find on expeditions, too. Anyone want to confirm that? (The Mock that went Feather-hunting found it with no problems. A year later, when his stats were starting to drop, he went through 10+ resets on the Altar and found nothing resembling a Mask, and mostly Mint Leaves and Irritaters and Half-Eatens even with 800+ INT.) If so, time for me to start building a better Mock.

By torey_luvullo on Wednesday, June 21, 2000 - 04:03 pm:

i once read that the lif requirement was 300, but i have been visited by doc talico when mine was ~280. actually, most of my expedition monsters were late-stage monsters. instead of freezing or battling away their early stage 5, i tend to send them on an expedition or two. they find some good stuff - but who knows what they could have found a little younger..
